explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 28degC (c.c.) (ICSC (2002)). Classified into Classes 3 and 8 (UN#2357) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 293degC (ICSC, 2003)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though it "acts on aluminum, copper and zinc" according to ICSC (2003). Classified into "Class 8: corrosive substances" by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (UN#2357). However, the category includes skin corrosivity, and hence does not allow the metal corrosivity of cyclohexylamine to be determined.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 156mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 800mg/kg and 156mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of 277mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours) value of 2,000ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (16-hour inhalation exposure) of 1,000ppm (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (2,480ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 250Pa (20degC), the substance is considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)): "Corrosive" (though exposure duration is unknown). Also due to the fact that the substance is assigned to "C; R34: Corrosive" by EU Risk Phrase. Although classified into Categories 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety, if further subclassification is needed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)): "Corrosive."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No data available

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests) and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), described in IARC 73 (1999), CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002) and MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001) and Group 3 by IARC (1987).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of adverse effects on the testes and decreased weaning indices, described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002) and MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004), although no data are available on parental toxicity.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system, nervous system, respiratory organs) Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "a slight degree of methemoglobin formation and sympathetic nervous stimulation" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)), "dizziness, somnolency, anxiety and nausea were observed in subjects, one of whom exhibited unintelligible articulation, vomiting and mydriasis" (MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004)), the evidence from animal studies including "very strong irritation" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system, thyroid gland, heart, kidneys, respiratory organs) Category 2 (testes)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "decreases in hemoglobin concentration/RBC count, reticulocytosis, hypothyroidism, fatty/granule degeneration of myocardium and kidney, inflammatory changes in the trachea and lung" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)), "focal vacuolation of Sertoli cells and degeneration/loss of sperm mother cells" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-54 (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (blood system, heart, kidneys, respiratory organs) and Category 2 (testes).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96 hours LC50=33mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 1997).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 61.6% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=1.49 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
